Subjective: Sore throat x3 days, unbearable, painful swallowing. Fever since morning. Cough started last week, now resolved. Meds: Paracetamol, Ibuprofen taken, no relief. Painful swallowing, impacts drinking. Negatives: No shortness of breath, no cold symptoms (runny nose), no current cough. Social: None mentioned. ICE: Suspects abscess, wants antibiotics, expects faster recovery with antibiotics.
Objective: Temp 38.3 C. Sat 98%. Ears: Left: air-filled eardrum, no inflammation. Right: slight redness in ear canal, otherwise normal, no inflammation. Neck: Small submandibular lymph nodes, not pathological. Throat: Median uvula, slightly red pharyngeal arch, slightly enlarged tonsils (not kissing), little slough on both sides. No abscess suspected. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds.
Assessment: Viral throat infection. Ruled out: Abscess.
Plan: 1. Explanation: Viral infection, antibiotics ineffective. 2. Meds: Paracetamol 1000mg 4x daily. Ibuprofen 400mg 3x daily (if paracetamol insufficient). 3. Advice: Plenty of fluids, cold drinks/popsicles for pain. 4. Safety net: Contact if much sicker, shortness of breath, or unable to swallow properly.
